main.name: Jacqueline Moore
main.description: a technical writer, a photographer, and a climber.
main.bio: I'm a second-year undergraduate student at the University of California, Davis, where I'm double-majoring in biomedical engineering and English.
main.listIntro: To help you get to know me, I penned a list of important facts about myself:
bioList: My favorite podcast is called 'No Such Thing As A Fish.'
One of my personal goals is to climb Half Dome in Yosemite.
Another goal is to bake the perfect loaf of banana bread. (This has proven to be just as formidable as climbing Half Dome.)
I'm a huge San Francisco Giants fan! Every summer, I head to AT&T Park to watch baseball games with my dad.
My favorite book is Ian McEwan's 'Atonement.' My least favorite book is 'The Catcher in the Rye.'
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: BioInnovation Group (previously Synthetic Biology Club), Society of Women Engineers, The California Aggie (newspaper), Pre-Law Association, UC Davis Climbing Club.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Composing user interface text for Einstein Analytics, Salesforce’s data analysis software. Also using Einstein Analytics to create interactive customer support resources.

work.title: Chief Content Officer & Microfluidics Team Lead
work.description: As CCO, created new design, pages, and content for the company website. Revamping the onboarding process for new researchers. As Team Lead, currently co-leading the Microfluidics Team in building a cost-effective microfluidic chip reader. Previously a member of the Vegan Cheese team, which worked on synthesizing casein proteins in yeast.

work.title: Copy Editor
work.description: Using the AP Style Guide to proofread copy — generally 25 articles per week. Previously composed campus news stories — one article per week.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Wrote instructions for bulk scripts feature, edited technical documentation about application build-up, performed data analysis of user and site traffic with Google Analytics.

work.title: Researcher
work.description: Created red fluorescent protein-expressing E. coli by cloning RFP gene in plasmid vector. Performed spectrophotometry tests, then analyzed data from those tests using qualitative and quantitative analyses.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Wrote appraisal reports about valuations of clients' properties, conducted research into properties and local real estate markets, executive assistance (scheduling meetings, taking phone messages).

work.title: Marketing Intern
work.description: Launched client interview protocol for company outreach project, composed news briefs about company's property acquisitions.

work.title: Intern Reporter
work.description: Penned news articles about campus events and faculty, interviewed Stanford faculty to gather information for articles.

work.company: The Arthur Morgan Institute for Community Solutions
work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Conducted research into the Keystone XL Pipeline to assist other interns in writing a grant about tar sands oil pipelines. Helped revamp the company’s website, communitysolution.org. (The site  has since been updated.)

projects.title: MANUAL: Adding Raspberry Pi to remote.it
COPY: remote.it email update for new feature
LAB REPORT: RFP Expression in Plasmids

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
